intro: Weberbauera densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered Weberbauera, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its densely packed, small, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
